Source: Combination of WSC and enhanced Winograd Schema Challenge dataset from the paper The Sensitivity of Language Models and Humans to Winograd Schema Perturbations
Definition:
You will be given two sentences. One of them is created by paraphrasing the original one, with changes on an aspect, or with the use of synonyms. Your task is to decide what is the difference between two sentences. Types of change are explained below:
 Tense: The verbs in the sentence are changed in tense.
Number: Plural nouns, verbs and pronouns are changed into single ones, or the other way around.
Voice: If the verbs are in active voice, they're changed to passive, or the other way around.
Adverb: The paraphrase has one adverb or more than the original sentence.
Gender: The paraphrase differs from the original sentence in the gender of the names and pronouns.
Synonym: Some words or phrases of the original sentence are replace with synonym words or phrases. Changes in the names of people is also considered a synonym change.#OneAdverb #SentencesAdverb #TheVerbs #Phrases #Synonym:SomeWords #What #TheGender #TheParaphrase #ASynonymChange #TheUse #Change #YourTask #Tense #TheOriginalOne #SynonymWords #TwoSentences #TheOriginalSentence #Verbs #ConsideredSentencesAdverb #AnAspect #ActiveVoice #Gender #TaskDifferenceSentencesVerbsParaphraseParaphrase #TheOtherWay #TheDifference

Positive Examples.input: original sentence: Steve follows Fred's example in everything .   He admires him hugely . paraphrase: Steve and Matt follow Fred and Jim's example in everything .   They  admire them hugely .
Positive Examples.explanation: There is a change in the number of the sentence.

Positive Examples.input: original sentence: Sid explained his theory to Mark but he couldn't convince him . paraphrase: Sid and Johnny explained their theory to Mark and Andrew but they couldn't convince them .
Positive Examples.explanation: There is a change in the number of the sentence.

Negative Examples.input: original sentence: John was doing research in the library when he heard a man humming and whistling .   He was very annoying . paraphrase: John is doing research in the library when he hears a man humming and whistling . He is very annoying .
Negative Examples.explanation: There is a change in the tense of the sentence.

Negative Examples.input: original sentence: Everyone really loved the oatmeal cookies ; only a few people liked the chocolate chip cookies .  Next time ,  we should make more of   them . paraphrase: Everyone really loved the oatmeal cookie ; only a few people liked the chocolate chip cookie .  Next time ,  we should make more of   it .
Negative Examples.explanation: There is a change in the tense of the sentence.
